intro: Renealmia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican renealmia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. It is native to Central America, particularly Costa Rica, and thrives in wetland and marshy environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or brownish in color. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a plant of conservation interest in certain regions.
